text:
I get the following exception when trying to use Tomcat 4.0 to server a JSP.  This happens mostly for large JSP pages.  I can get around it by changing the value of 

org.apache.Jasper.Constants.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE to a large enough value.

Below is the stack trace
=================================
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Buffer size cannot be changed after data has been written
	at org.apache.catalina.connector.ResponseBase.setBufferSize(ResponseBase.java:701)
	at javax.servlet.ServletResponseWrapper.setBufferSize(ServletResponseWrapper.java:172)
	at javax.servlet.ServletResponseWrapper.setBufferSize(ServletResponseWrapper.java:172)
	at org.apache.catalina.servlets.DefaultServlet.serveResource(DefaultServlet.java:1358)
	at org.apache.catalina.servlets.DefaultServlet.doGet(DefaultServlet.java:419)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:740)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher.invoke(ApplicationDispatcher.java:517)
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org

text:
You can Change the buffer size in the <%@ page %> directive to a larger value.

Once any data has been written to the buffer, you will get an 
IllegalStateException if the size is changed.
creator: justyna.horwat@sun.com
